Make it easier for processing invoices through Corporate with sub/teachers account.
The representative answered my email inquiry quickly.
Time waited for call back.

I asked about how the school gave us specific code to put in and specific instructions to not use the teacher and school search. Your customer service reps informed me to notify the school that it is no longer necessary. It is not appropriate to have me notify them when you are the ones with the contract with the school. Unprofessional. I should not be told to notify the school of your removal of the code.

The customer service reps I talked with tried their best to help me with my issue, but neither of them were successful. My case was transferred to the tech department, but I have not heard anything else about it, nor was I given a contact to follow up on the issue. As of right now, our school cannot order Scholastic books through book clubs because of this issue.

Scholastic has always been great and anwering my order or points questions. I appreciate their knowle and kind staff😊

I was inquiring about the birthday gift certificates for students. I was told at this point that they are not available. I’m hoping that will change and scholastic will offer them again. I’m hoping that you will again make the scholastic birthday gift certificates available.
Great to work with and replied to email very fast!!
No Comments

I am not a fan of the set due dates that Scholastic put in place. I liked having the flexibility to accommodate families and functions at our school. The decreased 'free' books, coupons, and points earned is also a concern for me, as I regularly used Scholastic to stock and upgrade my classroom library.  I believe this protocol will greatly impact the amount of new books I can add to my library.  However, I do like the move to fewer flyers.

I am upset about old promotions that no longer exist. This might lead me to not spending as much money or going to another business to order books. I am very disappointed about past offers not being an offer anymore like the book of the week and $1 book room after a certain amount of money is spent on a class order. I feel that buying books is becoming more and more expensive which is not feasible for some of my students.
I was disappointed that I am unable to set my own due date Would like to set my own due date and be able to edit letters to parents
Response was very quick, and taken care of right away.

I want to be able to change my order due dates each month. It's ridiculous that I can't. We teachers know our schedule and what works best for us; not anybody at Scholastic knows this. Also, your customer service representative that was assigned to me was quite ignorant and curt. How disappointing.

The customer service was just fine, however I'm disappointed in the changes that have been made regarding student ordering. Going to strictly online ordering is disappointing. We have families with circumstances that keep them from being able to order online.  I was provided a less then convenient way to help these families order and especially since tax is now in addition to the price shown in the flyers this makes the solution that was provided even more inconvenient. I am hesitant to even offer Scholastic Book Clubs as abest option for families to purchase books for their children.
If the flyer had a link to the book order so I could click on the book and order it from there.

I'm disappointed with the changes in ordering strictly on line and no information was sent to us about it.  I have been ordering for 27 years and nothing was explained about the changes and no info to send home. The parents are suppose to figure it out on their own on the back of the order form. Again, I would have appreciated info about the changes this year in the order forms.  I was waiting for other order forms to be sent out and had to research it on my own to figure the new procedures out!
No Comments
I think the person who responded did a great job but I still can't locate the parent letters to attach to the flyers to send home. I need the parent letters to attach to the flyers to send home.

The woman that helped me out today was very patient and kind. I love that it was an enjoyable call, in addition to her helping solve my issue. I am one happy customer and pleased with the service I received!
helpful and quick!

Your new ordering system is not working out for families that are unable to go online or have a language barrier where they can't understand what to do when they're online.  Giving parents the option to pay online or in person via teacher was great but now it's all online. Some parents are continuing to pay with checks and giving it to me, so I was told by rep there's a tax that is added since I am paying as a teacher.  That is SO wrong!  There is NO option for families to pay through teachers anymore.  And if they do, we as teachers, are responsible for all the taxes because we're not going to be asking parents for another dollar once the check is written.  I usually have a lot of students ordering but this is the FIRST year where I only have 2 and that's it.  I asked the parents and students why and they said it's too much of a hassle.  If you are looking for a way to have less books ordered by parents who cant go online then it's working.

I am not a parent. I have never had my own children.  I am an educator. I went in to update my information and spend my points and you down graded my account to parent and denied my request. I am a University of Missouri 4-H Youth Specialist. My contract litterally says "90% Extension Teaching".   And then I get hung up on when I am being transfered and no one calls me back?! You have my phone number in multiple places. This is ridiculous.

The rep gave me the answer I sought, but it is something new that Scholastic is doing thinking they are helping teachers. I didn't want that. So I created my own parent letter with my own due date. Let teachers have control on due dates again.

I am very disappointed in the changes that have been made to book clubs the past 2 years. This year we cannot manage our own due dates and you aren't sending flyers home anymore. That is the best part of getting books is being able to take the flyer home. This will be the last year I will be using scholastic.

I was not given an option to edit the date of the book orders. I would like to be able to do this as some of our families have different pay days and they asked the orders to be turned in near that date. This survey took a little time to complete because I had to look for the "next" button.
I was cut off and there was no answer at all
I am simply in awe of how quickly I was able to be helped. The Scholastic customer service team and IT team did a great job helping me out.
Return Club leo so I can order booktrust books for my class in Spanish. Please return CLUB LEO
No Comments

I am frustrated with how the new bonus point shop is laid out.  I am also frustrated that iPads are no longer available, as well as many other items I have been keeping an eye on. Please bring back the options to purchase iPads and Apple Watches with bonus points.  Thank you!
The chat format worked well and was efficient; however, some of the changes that were made in your program I do not care for.
I am very sad to see the dollar book store and the weekly $1 books are no longer available.
I do not like the new way the order dates work. The employee interaction was fine.
Great customer service through the chat feature.  We also asked for a follow up email so that we could remember the steps to follow and we were able to get that right away.  Thank you!
No Comments

I know the people answering the emails have no power over the concerns I had, so I asked for information on who to contact.  All I got was that my concerns would be forwarded.  No actual answer to my question and no acknowledgment of my concerns. I want to set my own date and I want my students to be able to order with paper slips and not be forced to order online.  It is making it harder for students to get books.

Received a rolling cart with 2 broken drawers. The cart has already been put together and cannot be mailed back. Requesting replacement of the 2 drawers. Was told someone would be in contact with me and no one has reached out. Feel the customer rep only said that so she could get off the phone.
I hope you will bring back the gift cards to buy using points.  I was disappointed that you no longer offer gift cards for teachers to purchase using bonus points.
Unfortunately, I have to ask my head teacher to submit the large order, however we are friends and she would give me the points earned should I ask. We’ll use them for our classroom- all good!
1.00$ books  More sets for holidays  Your prices seem very high

I just don't like the new fliers it's way to expensive for families. There are no $2 books for low income families. We may not be able to order from scholastic this year because there expensive. Which is sad and disappointing.
My question was answered. I'm waiting for my paper flyers to arrive in the mail.

I tried to use bonus points in June to purchase target gift cards to use towards and iPad. I didn’t have enough points for the iPad via scholastic. Now it turned out you don’t do target gift cards. Seems like something could have been arranged. I asked preciously to pay the difference between my 30000 points and the price of the iPad  To say I am disappointed is an understatement. Especially given my administration of scholastic book clubs in my classroom.
Reinstitute the birthday coupon booklet!
Nothing really.
The email response was quick and understandable.
It's frustrating that dates have been preset to have orders submitted. It feels like not enough outreach was done to explain this big change.
None
You have changed the way parents can order without even letting teachers know--very disappointed.

I do not like recent changes that were put in place and feel like it's a disadvantage to teachers. I am frustrated that I cannot pick my due date. I cannot order books for my students or classroom until a parent puts in an order - unless I pay for shipping (which I refuse to do). This means, if a parent waits until the middle of October to buy books, I have to wait a whole 2 months to get books for my classroom. Plus, the more money that is spent, the more bonus points I earn. So I'm at a complete disadvantage to earn free books for my classroom with bonus points by putting in orders right away. If a parent puts in an order in September, I purposely won't submit that order until October so that I can try to build up my bonus points. That's ridiculous for both parties involved. You're not making anything "easier" for teachers, as was described to me in my live chat. Picking a due date isn't work for teachers. These new protocols make things harder for teachers, which is a shame on Scholastic.

I do not like the fact that the due date for the Scholastic Flyers are already set for the teachers.  We should be able to set the due date if we want.  There should be an optional choice to do it.  I have to print the copy of the teacher letter to parents, white out the date and hand write in my due date that I am setting.
How do I change the date the book order is due by?

I asked a question of Scholastic and never received an answer about the Macbook in the teacher store. I have been saving and working for years to save points to obtain this computer. I finally received an email from your company only to say that it is not available. My school and I have been loyal customers for years. I want Scholastic to find a way to make this happen - one computer for all the points I have saved up for this for years and the fact that I contacted your company about it last year with no response.

My issues was with your ordering on line.  When I first went in to release an on line order, it told me I had earned $10 to spend right now.  I input one book then went to continue shopping for another book and then it would not longer allow me to order any books.  I was just told it was an error on your end and that it would be reported

My customer service representative was very helpful and I would rate her a 5.  My disappointment is in your reduction of $2 books to only one per month.  I think that this limits the number of families that can order.  As a teacher, it also limits the number of books that I can order for my students.  I have a program where every student  in my class gets a $2 book once a month.  Now I have to choose the one book you have to offer.

I want to note that Julie Reel gave me excellent customer service.  She was well versed in the book trust program, which I really appreciated.  I feel she went above and beyond in providing customer service, reaching out to her manager when she did not know an answer, following up with me to make sure I had the correct contact information and any new information she received.  I truly felt like I was her top priority, even though I know she must field hundreds of calls a day.  I just wanted to reach out and let management know what a valuable resource Julie is to me.
I will wait and see how the ordering of books go this school year.  It has been very discouraging to see the few points and books in which I receive for promoting your product.  Lynn

The change away from teachers entering student orders, and away from estimated tax being included on flyer orders, is a change for the worse. In a low-resource community like my school, we have many parents who do not have credit cards, and some do not even have bank accounts; they operate with cash whenever possible. Those students will not be able to order books. Some students save up lunch money to buy books. Either allowing teachers to enter cash orders, or figuring tax into prices so we could accept them and pay through our own accounts, is really a needed service for me to continue to use Scholastic with my students.

Not teacher friendly for us to not be able to set up our own due dates.  I want to be able to change that online but it's not possible.  I do not want to have the due date in October when I sent the book order home in August.
So far I am happy with the process.  However, I can't give my final rating until I receive the replacement books I requested. I think it will be, just waiting for my replacement books.
Quick response to online chat and my question was answered.
